org.xchain.framework.util

Class IoUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.util.IoUtil

  • public class IoUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of useful static methods for doing io operation.
    Author:
    Mike Moulton, Christian Trimble, John Trimble, Josh Kennedy

      • close

        public static void close(java.io.InputStream in,
         org.slf4j.Logger log)
        Closes an input stream if it is not null. If an IOException is raised during closing of the stream, it is ignored.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to close, or null.

      • close

        public static void close(java.io.OutputStream out,
         org.slf4j.Logger log)
        Closes an output stream if it is not null. If an IOException is raised during closing of the stream, it is ignored.
        Parameters:
        out - the output stream to close, or null.

      • copyStream

        public static void copyStream(java.io.InputStream in,
              java.io.OutputStream out,
              int bufferSize)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the input stream bytes into the output stream bytes, using the specified buffer size when transfering the bytes. This method does not close the streams when it completes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copyStream

        public static void copyStream(java.io.Reader reader,
              java.io.Writer writer,
              int buffer_length)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the content of a reader into a writer, using the specified buffer size while transfering the characters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getFileStream

        public static java.io.InputStream getFileStream(java.lang.String name,
                                org.slf4j.Logger log)
                                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Utility method to return an InputStream from either a File on the system path, or from the ConextClassLoader to a resource on the Class Path. Prefers Local System over Class Path. Throws File Not Found Exception if it does not exist in either place.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
